name: vscode-ec0lint
description: Integrates ec0lint JavaScript into VS Code.
author: ec0hub

virtualWorkspaces.description: Using ec0lint is not possible in virtual workspaces.

untrustedWorkspaces.description: The extension requires workspace trust because it loads configuration files and code from the workspace and executes it.

ec0lint.enable.description: Controls whether ec0lint is enabled or not.

ec0lint.packageManager.description: The package manager you use to install node modules.

ec0lint.problems.shortenToSingleLine.description: Shortens the text spans of underlined problems to their first related line.

ec0lint.nodeEnv.markdownDescription: The value of `NODE_ENV` to use when running ec0lint tasks.

ec0lint.nodePath.markdownDescription: A path added to `NODE_PATH` when resolving the ec0lint module.

ec0lint.options.markdownDescription: The ec0lint options object to provide args normally passed to ec0lint when executed from a command line (see https://ec0lint.com/docs/developer-guide/nodejs-api#eslint-class).

ec0lint.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VSCode and the ec0lint linter service.

ec0lint.run.description: Run the linter on save (onSave) or on type (onType)

ec0lint.quiet.description: Turns on quiet mode, which ignores warnings.

ec0lint.onIgnoredFiles.description: Whether ec0lint should issue a warning on ignored files.

directory.description: The working directory to use if a file's path starts with this directory.

changeProcessCWD.description: Whether the process's cwd should be changed as well.

directory.description: The working directory to use if a file's path starts with this directory.

!cwd.description: Set to true if ec0lint shouldn't change the working directory.

pattern.description: A glob pattern to match a working directory.

!cwd.description: Set to true if ec0lint shouldn't change the working directory.

ec0lint.workingDirectories.markdownDescription: Specifies how the working directories ec0lint is using are computed. ec0lint resolves configuration files (e.g. `ec0lintrc`, `.ec0lintignore`) relative to a working directory so it is important to configure this correctly.

language.description: The language id to be validated by ec0lint.

autoFix.description: Whether auto fixes are provided for the language.

anyOf.deprecationMessage: Auto Fix is enabled by default. Use the single string form.

ec0lint.validate.description: An array of language ids which should be validated by ec0lint. If not installed ec0lint will show an error.

ec0lint.ignoreUntitled.description: If true, untitled files won't be validated by ec0lint.

ec0lint.probe.description: An array of language ids for which the extension should probe if support is installed.

ec0lint.lintTask.enable.description: Controls whether a task for linting the whole workspace will be available.

ec0lint.lintTask.options.markdownDescription: Command line options applied when running the task for linting the whole workspace (see https://ec0lint.com/docs/user-guide/command-line-interface).

ec0lint.runtime.markdownDescription: The location of the node binary to run ec0lint under.

ec0lint.execArgv.markdownDescription: Additional exec argv argument passed to the runtime. This can for example be used to control the maximum heap space using --max_old_space_size

ec0lint.debug.markdownDescription: Enables ec0lint debug mode (same as `--debug` on the command line)

location.description: Configure the disable rule code action to insert the comment on the same line or a new line.

commentStyle.definition: The comment style to use when disabling a rule on a specific line.

ec0lint.codeAction.disableRuleComment.markdownDescription: Show disable lint rule in the quick fix menu.

ec0lint.codeAction.showDocumentation.markdownDescription: Show open lint rule documentation web page in the quick fix menu.

enumDescriptions: Fixes all possible problems in the file. This option might take some time.
Fixes only reported problems that have non-overlapping textual edits. This option runs a lot faster.
ec0lint.codeActionsOnSave.mode.markdownDescription: Specifies the code action mode. Possible values are 'all' and 'problems'.

ec0lint.codeActionsOnSave.rules.markdownDescription: The rules that should be executed when computing the code actions on save or formatting a file. Defaults to the rules configured via the ec0lint configuration

ec0lint.rules.customizations.description: Override the severity of one or more rules reported by this extension, regardless of the project's ec0lint config. Use globs to apply default severities for multiple rules.

ec0lint.notebooks.rules.customizations.description: A special rules customization section for text cells in notebook documents.

scripts.webpack: npm run clean && webpack --mode production --config ./client/webpack.config.js && webpack --mode production --config ./server/webpack.config.js
scripts.webpack:dev: npm run clean && webpack --mode none --config ./client/webpack.config.js && webpack --mode none --config ./server/webpack.config.js
